data.question: What is the ionic radius of Cd2+ as mentioned in the text?
Which metal ions cause a significant CHEF effect with DPP?
Does Zn2+ exhibit a CHEF effect with DPP?
What is the coordination number of Cd(II) in the complex [Cd(DPP)2](ClO4)2?
Can DPP detect Cd2+ concentrations down to 10-9 M?
What is the log K1 value for the Cd(II)/DPP complex?
Is the DPP ligand planar when coordinated to metal ions?
What method is traditionally used for detecting low levels of Cd2+ in the environment?
What is the detection limit of anodic stripping voltammetry for Cd2+?
Does the structure of [Cd(DPP)2]2+ show that DPP ligands are twisted?
What is the main reason for the high thermodynamic stability of DPP complexes with metal ions?
data.answer: The rigidity of the five-membered chelate rings formed by DPP

data.question: Does the presence of 10-6 M Zn2+, Hg2+, and Pb2+ significantly affect the fluorescence of 10-8 M DPP?
What is the effect of Ca2+ on the CHEF sensing of Cd2+ in seawater?
data.answer: Ca2+ at 10-3 M concentration in seawater can interfere with the detection of Cd2+ by DPP

data.question: What is the proposed method to eliminate interference from Ca2+ in seawater when detecting Cd2+ using DPP?
data.answer: Using masking ligands such as nitrilotriacetic acid (NTA)

data.question: What is the potential improvement of using DPP to detect Cd2+ compared to traditional methods?
data.answer: DPP could reliably be used to detect Cd2+ by the CHEF effect down to a concentration of 10-9 M

data.question: Is the DPP ligand capable of hydrogen bonding with the solvent when coordinated to a metal ion?
What is the role of the extended aromatic system of DPP in its complexes?
data.answer: It provides an excellent combination of coordinating groups and fluorophores

data.question: Does the structure of [Hg(DPP)(ClO4)2] show that Hg is 8-coordinate?
What is the maximum coordination number found for Hg(II) in the Cambridge Crystallographic Data Centre?
What is the effect of the rigidity of the phen moiety of DPP on the CHEF effect for Zn(II)?
data.answer: The rigidity leads to very long Zn−N bonds, limiting overlap and allowing the lone pairs to still quench the fluorescence of the aromatic system
